name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.
author: Harper Lee

description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the future.
author: George Orwell

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel of manners that depicts the British Regency era.
author: Jane Austen

name: The Great Gatsby
description: A novel about the American dream and the roaring twenties.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A novel about teenage rebellion and angst.
author: J.D. Salinger

name: Moby Dick
description: A novel about the voyage of the whaling ship Pequod.
author: Herman Melville

name: War and Peace
description: A novel that chronicles the French invasion of Russia.
author: Leo Tolstoy

name: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy novel about the quest of home-loving hobbit Bilbo Baggins.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
description: A young wizard's journey begins.
author: J.K. Rowling

name: The Lord of the Rings
description: An epic high-fantasy novel set in Middle-earth.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

name: The Alchemist
description: A novel about a shepherd's journey to realize his Personal Legend.
author: Paulo Coelho

name: Little Women
description: The lives of four sisters during the Civil War era.
author: Louisa May Alcott

name: The Catch-22
description: A satirical novel set during World War II.
author: Joseph Heller

name: The Grapes of Wrath
description: A novel about the Great Depression and a family's hardships.
author: John Steinbeck

name: Jane Eyre
description: A novel about the life of an orphaned girl and her moral and spiritual development.
author: Charlotte Bronte

name: Wuthering Heights
description: A tale of passion and revenge set on the Yorkshire moors.
author: Emily Bronte

name: Brave New World
description: A dystopian novel about a future society.
author: Aldous Huxley

name: Fahrenheit 451
description: A novel about a future society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn them.
author: Ray Bradbury

name: The Chronicles of Narnia
description: A series of fantasy novels set in the magical land of Narnia.
author: C.S. Lewis

name: Crime and Punishment
description: A novel about the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of a poor ex-student who kills a pawnbroker.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

name: The Odyssey
description: An epic poem about Odysseus' journey home after the fall of Troy.
author: Homer

name: The Divine Comedy
description: An epic poem about Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.
author: Dante Alighieri

name: Don Quixote
description: A novel about the adventures of a noble who reads too many chivalric romances and decides to become a knight-errant.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

name: Anna Karenina
description: A novel about the tragic romance between Anna Karenina and Count Vronsky.
author: Leo Tolstoy

name: Ulysses
description: A modernist novel that parallels Homer's Odyssey in a stream-of-consciousness style.
author: James Joyce
